means: 限制( confine的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: He announced that the army and police had been confined to barracks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他通告说军队和警察已经被禁闭在营房中不得外出。

sentence.Network_en: The woman will be confined to a mental institution.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个女人将被关进精神病院。

sentence.Network_en: Health officials have successfully confined the epidemic to the Tabatinga area.
sentence.Network_cn: 卫生官员成功地将疫情控制在塔巴廷加地区。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 四六级阅读词汇 - 豆丁网 ... conference||会议 confined||被限制的 confirm||确定.
confinement中文 ... sophisticated society 高度发展的社会 ... confined 有限的 confinement 限制.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... confine v 限制，监禁 confined a 有限制的； 狭窄的 define v 限定；下定义.
water is abundance but confined water is scarcity ., 地下潜水较多而承压水少.

...confined type geothermal reservoir 圈闭式地热储confined water 承压水confining pressure 封闭压力
confined water 受压水confining bed 不透水层confining layer 不透水层

entry.def: If something is confined to a particular place, it exists only in that place. If it is confined to a particular group, only members of that group have it.

example.ex: The problem is not confined to Germany...
These dangers are not confined to smokers.
example.tran: 这些危险不只是困扰吸烟者。

entry.def: A confined space or area is small and enclosed by walls.

example.ex: His long legs bent up in the confined space.
example.tran: 他的两条长腿蜷在狭小的空间里。

entry.def: If someone is confined to a wheelchair, bed, or house, they have to stay there, because they are disabled or ill.

example.ex: He had been confined to a wheelchair since childhood.

means.word_mean: 4. deprived of liberty; especially placed under arrest or restraint

auth_sentence.content: The controversy is not only confined to the Internet.
auth_sentence.res_content: The controversy is not only confined to the Internet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The controversy is not only confined to the Internet.

auth_sentence.content: The variant spelling prophesy is...now confined to the verb.
auth_sentence.res_content: The variant spelling prophesy is...now confined to the verb.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The variant spelling prophesy is...now confined to the verb.

auth_sentence.content: Nor is such hacking confined to the energy infrastructure.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nor is such hacking confined to the energy infrastructure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nor is such hacking confined to the energy infrastructure.

stems_affixes.type_exp: =limit,boundary,end 表示"结束,范围,界限,限制"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 被限制的, 狭窄的, 分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: confine[v.限制;使不外出,禁闭n.[n.]界限,范围]+ed……的→adj.被限制的, 狭窄的, 分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 确切的,权威性的;最后的,决定性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: define[v.给……下定义;阐述;阐释;限定,规定]+itive……的→规定了的,决定了的
fine范围,限制→[罚款]以约束,限制

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给……下定义;阐述;阐释;限定,规定

stems_affixes.word_buile: fine范围,限制→[罚款]以约束,限制

Sentence.sentence: It is mainly confined to youngsters

means.word_mean: (指空间)有限的, 受限制的

sentences.en: It is hard to work efficiently in such a confined space.
sentences.cn: 在这样狭小的空间里工作很难提高效率。
